subject: [EVP-ITC Hacked my12-469
author: psfponies
full_text:
--0-133789575-1206833315=:90371
Content-Type: text/plain; charset=iso-8859-1
Content-Transfer-Encoding: 8bit

Well I went yesterday after work and picked up a RS12-469. Did the hack this afternoon surprising simple!! So if anyone can please help me with what else I need to get started I would appreciate it.  I do have some PC speakers and a small microphone to use. Not sure how to set it up.
   
  Thanks 
  Kay

Wiliam Clarke <reesclarke_69@...> wrote:
            For me it was the 12-469, It has worked well with me.  I did buy a 20-125, and hacked it correctly, and I didn't like it.  I also didn't get very much reception.  The 20-125 has a long anntena, and the 12-469 you can hold it in your hand, and you act as the anntena.  That way you get better reception.  Only problem with the 12-469 is that it clicks a little, but I can't hear it anymore.  I train not to hear it.
   
  Later 
  Rees

psfponies <psfponies@...> wrote:
        I am looking at getting either the 12-469 or 20-125. Which would be the best to get for someone who is just starting out. I will be doing the Hack myself with a little help and instructions. I want to get something fairly easy to hack and use for a beginner.
  Thanks
  Kay

Wiliam Clarke <reesclarke_69@...> wrote:
    Radio Shack FM/AM Radio 12-469 or 20-125

Wiliam Clarke <reesclarke_69@...> wrote:
        Radio Shack 12-469, 20-125 then you would have to modifiy it.  Some peps here can tell you how to do it, or you can go to ufogeek.com, and watch a video on how to do it.
   
  Rees

darkstarwolf2002 <darkstarwolf2002@...> wrote:
      been camping and reading post

I am the founder Of Trinity Paranormal's Western Oregon Chapter. I am 
very interested in experimenting with a box on our investigations.. how 
would a person get one??? yeh probly a lame question lol.
